entry.name: MAV_STORM32_TUNNEL_PAYLOAD_TYPE_STORM32_CH1_IN
entry.description: Registered for STorM32 gimbal controller.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_TUNNEL_PAYLOAD_TYPE_STORM32_CH1_OUT
entry.description: Registered for STorM32 gimbal controller.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_TUNNEL_PAYLOAD_TYPE_STORM32_CH2_IN
entry.description: Registered for STorM32 gimbal controller.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_TUNNEL_PAYLOAD_TYPE_STORM32_CH2_OUT
entry.description: Registered for STorM32 gimbal controller.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_TUNNEL_PAYLOAD_TYPE_STORM32_CH3_IN
entry.description: Registered for STorM32 gimbal controller.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_TUNNEL_PAYLOAD_TYPE_STORM32_CH3_OUT
entry.description: Registered for STorM32 gimbal controller.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_TUNNEL_PAYLOAD_TYPE_STORM32_RESERVED6
entry.description: Registered for STorM32 gimbal controller.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_TUNNEL_PAYLOAD_TYPE_STORM32_RESERVED7
entry.description: Registered for STorM32 gimbal controller.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_TUNNEL_PAYLOAD_TYPE_STORM32_RESERVED8
entry.description: Registered for STorM32 gimbal controller.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_TUNNEL_PAYLOAD_TYPE_STORM32_RESERVED9
entry.description: Registered for STorM32 gimbal controller.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_PREARM_FLAGS_IS_NORMAL
entry.description: STorM32 gimbal is in normal state.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_PREARM_FLAGS_IMUS_WORKING
entry.description: The IMUs are healthy and working normally.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_PREARM_FLAGS_MOTORS_WORKING
entry.description: The motors are active and working normally.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_PREARM_FLAGS_ENCODERS_WORKING
entry.description: The encoders are healthy and working normally.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_PREARM_FLAGS_VOLTAGE_OK
entry.description: A battery voltage is applied and is in range.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_PREARM_FLAGS_MAVLINK_RECEIVING
entry.description: Mavlink messages are being received.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_PREARM_FLAGS_STORM32LINK_QFIX
entry.description: The STorM32Link data indicates QFix.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_PREARM_FLAGS_STORM32LINK_WORKING
entry.description: The STorM32Link is working.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_PREARM_FLAGS_CAMERA_CONNECTED
entry.description: The camera has been found and is connected.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_PREARM_FLAGS_AUX0_LOW
entry.description: The signal on the AUX0 input pin is low.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_PREARM_FLAGS_AUX1_LOW
entry.description: The signal on the AUX1 input pin is low.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_PREARM_FLAGS_NTLOGGER_WORKING
entry.description: The NTLogger is working normally.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_CAMERA_PREARM_FLAGS_CONNECTED
entry.description: The camera has been found and is connected.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_DEVICE_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_RETRACT
entry.description: Gimbal device supports a retracted position.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_DEVICE_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_NEUTRAL
entry.description: Gimbal device supports a horizontal, forward looking position, stabilized. Can also be used to reset the gimbal's orientation.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_DEVICE_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_ROLL_AXIS
entry.description: Gimbal device supports rotating around roll axis.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_DEVICE_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_ROLL_FOLLOW
entry.description: Gimbal device supports to follow a roll angle relative to the vehicle.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_DEVICE_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_ROLL_LOCK
entry.description: Gimbal device supports locking to an roll angle (generally that's the default).

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_DEVICE_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_PITCH_AXIS
entry.description: Gimbal device supports rotating around pitch axis.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_DEVICE_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_PITCH_FOLLOW
entry.description: Gimbal device supports to follow a pitch angle relative to the vehicle.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_DEVICE_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_PITCH_LOCK
entry.description: Gimbal device supports locking to an pitch angle (generally that's the default).

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_DEVICE_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_YAW_AXIS
entry.description: Gimbal device supports rotating around yaw axis.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_DEVICE_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_YAW_FOLLOW
entry.description: Gimbal device supports to follow a yaw angle relative to the vehicle (generally that's the default).

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_DEVICE_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_YAW_LOCK
entry.description: Gimbal device supports locking to a heading angle.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_DEVICE_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_INFINITE_YAW
entry.description: Gimbal device supports yawing/panning infinitely (e.g. using a slip ring).

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_DEVICE_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_ABSOLUTE_YAW
entry.description: Gimbal device supports absolute yaw angles (this usually requires support by an autopilot, and can be dynamic, i.e., go on and off during runtime).

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_DEVICE_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_RC
entry.description: Gimbal device supports control via an RC input signal.

enum.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_DEVICE_FLAGS
enum.description: Flags for gimbal device operation. Used for setting and reporting, unless specified otherwise. Settings which are in violation of the capability flags are ignored by the gimbal device.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_DEVICE_FLAGS_RETRACT
entry.description: Retracted safe position (no stabilization), takes presedence over NEUTRAL flag. If supported by the gimbal, the angles in the retracted position can be set in addition.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_DEVICE_FLAGS_NEUTRAL
entry.description: Neutral position (horizontal, forward looking, with stabiliziation).

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_DEVICE_FLAGS_ROLL_LOCK
entry.description: Lock roll angle to absolute angle relative to horizon (not relative to drone). This is generally the default.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_DEVICE_FLAGS_PITCH_LOCK
entry.description: Lock pitch angle to absolute angle relative to horizon (not relative to drone). This is generally the default.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_DEVICE_FLAGS_YAW_LOCK
entry.description: Lock yaw angle to absolute angle relative to earth (not relative to drone). When the YAW_ABSOLUTE flag is set, the quaternion is in the Earth frame with the x-axis pointing North (yaw absolute), else it is in the Earth frame rotated so that the x-axis is pointing forward (yaw relative to vehicle).

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_DEVICE_FLAGS_CAN_ACCEPT_YAW_ABSOLUTE
entry.description: Gimbal device can accept absolute yaw angle input. This flag cannot be set, is only for reporting (attempts to set it are rejected by the gimbal device).

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_DEVICE_FLAGS_YAW_ABSOLUTE
entry.description: Yaw angle is absolute (is only accepted if CAN_ACCEPT_YAW_ABSOLUTE is set). If this flag is set, the quaternion is in the Earth frame with the x-axis pointing North (yaw absolute), else it is in the Earth frame rotated so that the x-axis is pointing forward (yaw relative to vehicle).

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_DEVICE_FLAGS_RC_EXCLUSIVE
entry.description: RC control. The RC input signal fed to the gimbal device exclusively controls the gimbal's orientation. Overrides RC_MIXED flag if that is also set.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_DEVICE_FLAGS_RC_MIXED
entry.description: RC control. The RC input signal fed to the gimbal device is mixed into the gimbal's orientation. Is overriden by RC_EXCLUSIVE flag if that is also set.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_DEVICE_FLAGS_NONE
entry.description: UINT16_MAX = ignore.

enum.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_DEVICE_ERROR_FLAGS
enum.description: Gimbal device error and condition flags (0 means no error or other condition).

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_DEVICE_ERROR_FLAGS_AT_ROLL_LIMIT
entry.description: Gimbal device is limited by hardware roll limit.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_DEVICE_ERROR_FLAGS_AT_PITCH_LIMIT
entry.description: Gimbal device is limited by hardware pitch limit.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_DEVICE_ERROR_FLAGS_AT_YAW_LIMIT
entry.description: Gimbal device is limited by hardware yaw limit.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_DEVICE_ERROR_FLAGS_ENCODER_ERROR
entry.description: There is an error with the gimbal device's encoders.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_DEVICE_ERROR_FLAGS_POWER_ERROR
entry.description: There is an error with the gimbal device's power source.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_DEVICE_ERROR_FLAGS_MOTOR_ERROR
entry.description: There is an error with the gimbal device's motors.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_DEVICE_ERROR_FLAGS_SOFTWARE_ERROR
entry.description: There is an error with the gimbal device's software.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_DEVICE_ERROR_FLAGS_COMMS_ERROR
entry.description: There is an error with the gimbal device's communication.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_DEVICE_ERROR_FLAGS_CALIBRATION_RUNNING
entry.description: Gimbal device is currently calibrating (not an error).

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_DEVICE_ERROR_FLAGS_NO_MANAGER
entry.description: Gimbal device is not assigned to a gimbal manager (not an error).

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_MANAGER_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_PROFILES
entry.description: The gimbal manager supports several profiles.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_MANAGER_CAP_FLAGS_SUPPORTS_CHANGE
entry.description: The gimbal manager supports changing the gimbal manager during run time, i.e. can be enabled/disabled.

enum.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_MANAGER_FLAGS
enum.description: Flags for gimbal manager operation. Used for setting and reporting, unless specified otherwise. If a setting is accepted by the gimbal manger, is reported in the STORM32_GIMBAL_MANAGER_STATUS message.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_MANAGER_FLAGS_NONE
entry.description: 0 = ignore.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_MANAGER_FLAGS_RC_ACTIVE
entry.description: Request to set RC input to active, or report RC input is active. Implies RC mixed. RC exclusive is achieved by setting all clients to inactive.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_MANAGER_FLAGS_CLIENT_ONBOARD_ACTIVE
entry.description: Request to set onboard/companion computer client to active, or report this client is active.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_MANAGER_FLAGS_CLIENT_AUTOPILOT_ACTIVE
entry.description: Request to set autopliot client to active, or report this client is active.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_MANAGER_FLAGS_CLIENT_GCS_ACTIVE
entry.description: Request to set GCS client to active, or report this client is active.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_MANAGER_FLAGS_CLIENT_CAMERA_ACTIVE
entry.description: Request to set camera client to active, or report this client is active.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_MANAGER_FLAGS_CLIENT_GCS2_ACTIVE
entry.description: Request to set GCS2 client to active, or report this client is active.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_MANAGER_FLAGS_CLIENT_CAMERA2_ACTIVE
entry.description: Request to set camera2 client to active, or report this client is active.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_MANAGER_FLAGS_CLIENT_CUSTOM_ACTIVE
entry.description: Request to set custom client to active, or report this client is active.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_MANAGER_FLAGS_CLIENT_CUSTOM2_ACTIVE
entry.description: Request to set custom2 client to active, or report this client is active.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_MANAGER_FLAGS_SET_SUPERVISON
entry.description: Request supervision. This flag is only for setting, it is not reported.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_MANAGER_FLAGS_SET_RELEASE
entry.description: Release supervision. This flag is only for setting, it is not reported.

enum.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_MANAGER_CLIENT
enum.description: Gimbal manager client ID. In a prioritizing profile, the priorities are determined by the implementation; they could e.g. be custom1 > onboard > GCS > autopilot/camera > GCS2 > custom2.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_MANAGER_CLIENT_NONE
entry.description: For convenience.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_MANAGER_CLIENT_ONBOARD
entry.description: This is the onboard/companion computer client.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_MANAGER_CLIENT_AUTOPILOT
entry.description: This is the autopilot client.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_MANAGER_CLIENT_GCS
entry.description: This is the GCS client.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_MANAGER_CLIENT_CAMERA
entry.description: This is the camera client.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_MANAGER_CLIENT_GCS2
entry.description: This is the GCS2 client.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_MANAGER_CLIENT_CAMERA2
entry.description: This is the camera2 client.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_MANAGER_CLIENT_CUSTOM
entry.description: This is the custom client.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_MANAGER_CLIENT_CUSTOM2
entry.description: This is the custom2 client.

enum.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_MANAGER_SETUP_FLAGS
enum.description: Flags for gimbal manager set up. Used for setting and reporting, unless specified otherwise.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_MANAGER_SETUP_FLAGS_ENABLE
entry.description: Enable gimbal manager. This flag is only for setting, is not reported.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_MANAGER_SETUP_FLAGS_DISABLE
entry.description: Disable gimbal manager. This flag is only for setting, is not reported.

enum.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_MANAGER_PROFILE
enum.description: Gimbal manager profiles. Only standard profiles are defined. Any implementation can define it's own profile in addition, and should use enum values > 16.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_MANAGER_PROFILE_DEFAULT
entry.description: Default profile. Implementation specific.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_MANAGER_PROFILE_CUSTOM
entry.description: Custom profile. Configurable profile according to the STorM32 definition. Is configured with STORM32_GIMBAL_MANAGER_PROFIL.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_MANAGER_PROFILE_COOPERATIVE
entry.description: Default cooperative profile. Uses STorM32 custom profile with default settings to achieve cooperative behavior.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_MANAGER_PROFILE_EXCLUSIVE
entry.description: Default exclusive profile. Uses STorM32 custom profile with default settings to achieve exclusive behavior.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_MANAGER_PROFILE_PRIORITY_COOPERATIVE
entry.description: Default priority profile with cooperative behavior for equal priority. Uses STorM32 custom profile with default settings to achieve priority-based behavior.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_MANAGER_PROFILE_PRIORITY_EXCLUSIVE
entry.description: Default priority profile with exclusive behavior for equal priority. Uses STorM32 custom profile with default settings to achieve priority-based behavior.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_ACTION_RECENTER
entry.description: Trigger the gimbal device to recenter the gimbal.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_ACTION_CALIBRATION
entry.description: Trigger the gimbal device to run a calibration.

entry.name: MAV_STORM32_GIMBAL_ACTION_DISCOVER_MANAGER
entry.description: Trigger gimbal device to (re)discover the gimbal manager during run time.

entry.name: MAV_QSHOT_MODE_UNDEFINED
entry.description: Undefined shot mode. Can be used to determine if qshots should be used or not.

entry.name: MAV_QSHOT_MODE_DEFAULT
entry.description: Start normal gimbal operation. Is usally used to return back from a shot.

entry.name: MAV_QSHOT_MODE_GIMBAL_RETRACT
entry.description: Load and keep safe gimbal position and stop stabilization.

entry.name: MAV_QSHOT_MODE_GIMBAL_NEUTRAL
entry.description: Load neutral gimbal position and keep it while stabilizing.

entry.name: MAV_QSHOT_MODE_GIMBAL_MISSION
entry.description: Start mission with gimbal control.

entry.name: MAV_QSHOT_MODE_GIMBAL_RC_CONTROL
entry.description: Start RC gimbal control.

entry.name: MAV_QSHOT_MODE_POI_TARGETING
entry.description: Start gimbal tracking the point specified by Lat, Lon, Alt.

entry.name: MAV_QSHOT_MODE_SYSID_TARGETING
entry.description: Start gimbal tracking the system with specified system ID.

entry.name: MAV_QSHOT_MODE_CABLECAM_2POINT
entry.description: Start 2-point cable cam quick shot.

entry.name: MAV_QSHOT_MODE_HOME_TARGETING
entry.description: Start gimbal tracking the home location.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_STORM32_DO_GIMBAL_MANAGER_CONTROL_PITCHYAW
entry.description: Command to a gimbal manager to control the gimbal tilt and pan angles. It is possible to set combinations of the values below. E.g. an angle as well as a desired angular rate can be used to get to this angle at a certain angular rate, or an angular rate only will result in continuous turning. NaN is to be used to signal unset. A gimbal device is never to react to this command.
entry.param: Pitch/tilt angle (positive: tilt up, NaN to be ignored).
Yaw/pan angle (positive: pan to the right, the frame is determined by the STORM32_GIMBAL_DEVICE_FLAGS_YAW_ABSOLUTE flag, NaN to be ignored).
Pitch/tilt rate (positive: tilt up, NaN to be ignored).
Yaw/pan rate (positive: pan to the right, the frame is determined by the STORM32_GIMBAL_DEVICE_FLAGS_YAW_ABSOLUTE flag, NaN to be ignored).

Gimbal ID of the gimbal manager to address (component ID or 1-6 for non-MAVLink gimbal, 0 for all gimbals, send command multiple times for more than one but not all gimbals). The client is copied into bits 8-15.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_STORM32_DO_GIMBAL_MANAGER_SETUP
entry.description: Command to configure a gimbal manager. A gimbal device is never to react to this command. The selected profile is reported in the STORM32_GIMBAL_MANAGER_STATUS message.
entry.param: Gimbal ID of the gimbal manager to address (component ID or 1-6 for non-MAVLink gimbal, 0 for all gimbals). Send command multiple times for more than one but not all gimbals.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_STORM32_DO_GIMBAL_ACTION
entry.description: Command to initiate gimbal actions. Usually performed by the gimbal device, but some can also be done by the gimbal manager. It is hence best to broadcast this command.
entry.param: Gimbal ID of the gimbal to address (component ID or 1-6 for non-MAVLink gimbal, 0 for all gimbals). Send command multiple times for more than one but not all gimbals.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_QSHOT_DO_CONFIGURE
entry.description: Command to set the shot manager mode.
entry.param: Set shot state or command. The allowed values are specific to the selected shot mode.

message.name: STORM32_GIMBAL_DEVICE_STATUS
message.description: Message reporting the current status of a gimbal device. This message should be broadcasted by a gimbal device component at a low regular rate (e.g. 4 Hz). For higher rates it should be emitted with a target.
message.field: System ID
Component ID
Timestamp (time since system boot).
Gimbal device flags currently applied.
Quaternion components, w, x, y, z (1 0 0 0 is the null-rotation). The frame depends on the STORM32_GIMBAL_DEVICE_FLAGS_YAW_ABSOLUTE flag.
X component of angular velocity (NaN if unknown).
Y component of angular velocity (NaN if unknown).
Z component of angular velocity (the frame depends on the STORM32_GIMBAL_DEVICE_FLAGS_YAW_ABSOLUTE flag, NaN if unknown).
Yaw in absolute frame relative to Earth's North, north is 0 (NaN if unknown).
Failure flags (0 for no failure).

message.name: STORM32_GIMBAL_DEVICE_CONTROL
message.description: Message to a gimbal device to control its attitude. This message is to be sent from the gimbal manager to the gimbal device. Angles and rates can be set to NaN according to use case.
message.field: System ID
Component ID
Gimbal device flags (UINT16_MAX to be ignored).
Quaternion components, w, x, y, z (1 0 0 0 is the null-rotation, the frame is determined by the STORM32_GIMBAL_DEVICE_FLAGS_YAW_ABSOLUTE flag, set first element to NaN to be ignored).
X component of angular velocity (positive: roll to the right, NaN to be ignored).
Y component of angular velocity (positive: tilt up, NaN to be ignored).
Z component of angular velocity (positive: pan to the right, the frame is determined by the STORM32_GIMBAL_DEVICE_FLAGS_YAW_ABSOLUTE flag, NaN to be ignored).

message.name: STORM32_GIMBAL_MANAGER_INFORMATION
message.description: Information about a gimbal manager. This message should be requested by a ground station using MAV_CMD_REQUEST_MESSAGE. It mirrors some fields of the STORM32_GIMBAL_DEVICE_INFORMATION message, but not all. If the additional information is desired, also STORM32_GIMBAL_DEVICE_INFORMATION should be requested.
message.field: Gimbal ID (component ID or 1-6 for non-MAVLink gimbal) that this gimbal manager is responsible for.
Gimbal device capability flags.
Gimbal manager capability flags.
Hardware minimum roll angle (positive: roll to the right, NaN if unknown).
Hardware maximum roll angle (positive: roll to the right, NaN if unknown).
Hardware minimum pitch/tilt angle (positive: tilt up, NaN if unknown).
Hardware maximum pitch/tilt angle (positive: tilt up, NaN if unknown).
Hardware minimum yaw/pan angle (positive: pan to the right, relative to the vehicle/gimbal base, NaN if unknown).
Hardware maximum yaw/pan angle (positive: pan to the right, relative to the vehicle/gimbal base, NaN if unknown).

message.name: STORM32_GIMBAL_MANAGER_STATUS
message.description: Message reporting the current status of a gimbal manager. This message should be broadcast at a low regular rate (e.g. 1 Hz, may be increase momentarily to e.g. 5 Hz for a period of 1 sec after a change).
message.field: Gimbal ID (component ID or 1-6 for non-MAVLink gimbal) that this gimbal manager is responsible for.
Client who is currently supervisor (0 = none).
Gimbal device flags currently applied.
Gimbal manager flags currently applied.
Profile currently applied (0 = default).

message.name: STORM32_GIMBAL_MANAGER_CONTROL
message.description: Message to a gimbal manager to control the gimbal attitude. Angles and rates can be set to NaN according to use case. A gimbal device is never to react to this message.
message.field: System ID
Component ID
Gimbal ID of the gimbal manager to address (component ID or 1-6 for non-MAVLink gimbal, 0 for all gimbals, send command multiple times for more than one but not all gimbals).
Client which is contacting the gimbal manager (must be set).
Gimbal device flags (UINT16_MAX to be ignored).
Gimbal manager flags (0 to be ignored).
Quaternion components, w, x, y, z (1 0 0 0 is the null-rotation, the frame is determined by the GIMBAL_MANAGER_FLAGS_ABSOLUTE_YAW flag, set first element to NaN to be ignored).
X component of angular velocity (positive: roll to the right, NaN to be ignored).
Y component of angular velocity (positive: tilt up, NaN to be ignored).
Z component of angular velocity (positive: pan to the right, the frame is determined by the STORM32_GIMBAL_DEVICE_FLAGS_YAW_ABSOLUTE flag, NaN to be ignored).

message.name: STORM32_GIMBAL_MANAGER_CONTROL_PITCHYAW
message.description: Message to a gimbal manager to control the gimbal tilt and pan angles. Angles and rates can be set to NaN according to use case. A gimbal device is never to react to this message.
message.field: System ID
Component ID
Gimbal ID of the gimbal manager to address (component ID or 1-6 for non-MAVLink gimbal, 0 for all gimbals, send command multiple times for more than one but not all gimbals).
Client which is contacting the gimbal manager (must be set).
Gimbal device flags (UINT16_MAX to be ignored).
Gimbal manager flags (0 to be ignored).
Pitch/tilt angle (positive: tilt up, NaN to be ignored).
Yaw/pan angle (positive: pan the right, the frame is determined by the STORM32_GIMBAL_DEVICE_FLAGS_YAW_ABSOLUTE flag, NaN to be ignored).
Pitch/tilt angular rate (positive: tilt up, NaN to be ignored).
Yaw/pan angular rate (positive: pan to the right, the frame is determined by the STORM32_GIMBAL_DEVICE_FLAGS_YAW_ABSOLUTE flag, NaN to be ignored).

message.name: STORM32_GIMBAL_MANAGER_CORRECT_ROLL
message.description: Message to a gimbal manager to correct the gimbal roll angle. This message is typically used to manually correct for a tilted horizon in operation. A gimbal device is never to react to this message.
message.field: System ID
Component ID
Gimbal ID of the gimbal manager to address (component ID or 1-6 for non-MAVLink gimbal, 0 for all gimbals, send command multiple times for more than one but not all gimbals).
Client which is contacting the gimbal manager (must be set).
Roll angle (positive to roll to the right).

message.name: STORM32_GIMBAL_MANAGER_PROFILE
message.description: Message to set a gimbal manager profile. A gimbal device is never to react to this command. The selected profile is reported in the STORM32_GIMBAL_MANAGER_STATUS message.
message.field: System ID
Component ID
Gimbal ID of the gimbal manager to address (component ID or 1-6 for non-MAVLink gimbal, 0 for all gimbals, send command multiple times for more than one but not all gimbals).
Profile to be applied (0 = default).
Priorities for custom profile.
Profile flags for custom profile (0 = default).
Rc timeouts for custom profile (0 = infinite, in uints of 100 ms).
Timeouts for custom profile (0 = infinite, in uints of 100 ms).

message.name: QSHOT_STATUS
message.field: Current shot mode.
Current state in the shot. States are specific to the selected shot mode.

message.name: COMPONENT_PREARM_STATUS
message.description: Message reporting the status of the prearm checks. The flags are component specific.
message.field: System ID
Component ID
Currently enabled prearm checks. 0 means no checks are being performed, UINT32_MAX means not known.
Currently not passed prearm checks. 0 means all checks have been passed.
